reviews.text:
I have to say that it it’s one of the most amazing views I have ever seen. This fortress takes you to the medieval times, or even gives you the feeling of being in a movie. Guess what? It’s absolutely free, no tickets to visit it something that blew my mind, in Spain to even enter in a cathedral you will have to pay 5€. 
Well done Alicante... many other towns should follow you example.
This was really great! So beautiful, and very interesting! We took the elevator up at night when there was absolutely no lines, and then we walk down after they closed, it was a very pretty walk
Wonderful and scenic views. Worth the €2.70 to take the elevator up. There are so many great spots to take photos. You can see the whole city from here. So many mountain ranges to see.

A lovely castle with amazing views! We took the lift up to the top which is very reasonably priced, though you can walk up for free if you have time. There is a small coffee shop near the lift and a restaurant situated in the lower end of the castle. Well worth a visit!

Beautiful fortress, well worth the walk up. Free to enter and complete with cafes and restaurants. There aren't many original artifacts left but the views from the top are stunning especially the mountains in the distance and the Alicante Bay.
Beautiful historical church, both inside and out. Ornate baroque decorations. Balcony inside ideal for choir or individual singers. Square outside ideal for gathering congregation.

Oldest church of Alicante. Lovely facade. Interiors were pleasant although nothing spectacular. Most interesting was however the 2 canon balls from 18th or 19th century seaside attacks atill embedded on one of the outside walls!

From our hotel room we looked right down onto the Basilica and it was quite a sight. With the window open you could sometimes hear someone praying or perhaps later a rowdy group of young students. It was such a sight. I could see from our room that someone had tossed a sneaker up onto the ledge so look at my pic. 
Inside was lovely and there was actually a service happening when we entered. 
Take your time and soak up everything g here as it is quite majestic s 
Wheelchair friendly. Kid friendly.
It was closed during our visit. A beautiful and   monumental building.
Stunning. Well worth a visit.  Located in centre of the shopping area.

Nice view and we have seen some interesting bird life there too. The area is quite dirty though, and there are a lot of dog poo around. There is a little park in one side and a larger abandoned area on the other. Would be a great place to picnic with a bit of care and attention.
Nothing special to see, but good for a walk. Amazing view from in to castle. Short distance from city center. Around are small gardens where you can have sit and have your lunch.

Gates are closed (I tried to enter from the South Gate, blue color, the only entrance Google is pointing out in the map), so I couldn't go up. But the stairs that take you to the gate gives you enough height to take panoramic pictures, can see very well the structure of the Santa Barbara castle from here, and a view of the city and the sea.  

It's is not well taken care of, lots of graffitis and broken glasses (beer bottles) around.  It could be better maintained and have a sign for visitors.

I haven't had enough time for looking for the other gate, there must be one (probably the main entrance?).  
I'd suggest that whoever manages to get there please contribute the details in Google map, thanks everyone :)

Not a lot of the structure is left but interesting to visit, explore and enjoy the wonderful views across Alicante. There is a very nice cafe restaurant bar which has an outside patio area where you can enjoy the views and some refreshments or even a meal. We visit most Sundays as we enjoy the exercise walking up there, then to sit and relax with a little refreshment prior to having their excellent choice of menu of the day.
A nice family hike in the middle of the city.  Worth to visit with kids. Don't forget your skateboard...
Really nice collection, but some of the rooms were closed and we can only see what is inside through the window.

Small.  Intimate.  Worth a visit.  One hour plus would suffice.  
Some paintings with English translation - Picasso’s teacher being one of them.  
Enjoyed a free musical evening - piano & student classical singers 
17th April @ 6.00 p.m.
Many interesting exhibitions and paintings in there. Definitely worth visiting when in Alicante.
TEMPORARILY CLOSED as of March 18
really interesting paintings - the best museum of Alicante
Excellent place. Free entrance, modern building. 100% recommendable.
Great architecture. Good exposition.

A gem of a museum nested within the University of Alicante campus.  Outstanding permanent collection as well as a variety of revolving exhibits of various artists.. Greater Spanish as well as local artists.  Well worth the visit.  Budget at least 2 hours, more if you can.
G e n i a l.
Unfortunately was closed. While it looks deteriorated and abandoned, the building is a remarkable piece of contemporary architecture

Amazing food, good example of the local cuisine, our server was very helpful and friendly. The pork ribs were so very good, falling the bone and melting in my mouth! The restaurant looks cramped when you walk on but has plenty of room for seating. I highly recommend this establishment
Wonderful, cozy and familiar place. The T-bone stitch is magic and the staff extremely friendly and service minded. A must if you are in Alicante.
Original delecius spanish food. Really good
Great food, traditional feel. The Ribs!!!
Fantastic Tapas Experience.

the bar downstairs looked awesome but we had a reservation upstairs. The atmosphere is very different but also really nice.
The food and service was brilliant and perfect combinations av different flavors. The tuna tartar was one of the best I've eaten and the lobster paella was equally good. The wine list was extended and we got very good recommendations.

An excellent restaurant with a charisma. From the moment you enter this place you feel how special it is. The food is extraordinary! From appetizers to main course and desserts. Staff are so lovely and friendly.  A truly wonderful experience I would recommend to everyone  :)

It is a very big restaurant but still has a queue outside!  Nice personal, good and attentive service, satisfying portions, tasteful and good quality dishes, especially pork with scallops. Meanwhile I didn't like the desert too much, the chocolate sauce was shadowing the delicate taste of turrón. Next time I will try the bar section.

Nice female chef. 10 cource dinner with 10 matching wines. Michelin worthy food for a decent price. They could do more with a non alcoholic cocktail or something. Not everyone is drinking wines these days. Location is nice as well. Specially in the summer you will be able to sit outside. We recommend this place if you are in alicante!!!
Perfect service, excellent food. SURE RECOMMENDABLE
I was there for a coffee and the view is amazing!!! You can see the castle, Postiguet and the port! I totally recommend it.

Amazing view of the city and harbour, service ok but food very poor and expensive for what it is. I would not recommend this restaurant for eating, an afternoon drink would be enough to enjoy the privilege position from the 26th floor.
Great food, service and view
Views are nice
Best views of Alicante from the this top floor restaurant at the Gran Sol Hotel . Service and food was very good . Reasonable prices too. Worth a try for the views alone!

Nice decor with good views of the harbour. Staff are very welcome and friendly. Set menu mediocre as was very salty including the rice. The wine was excellent. The lemon sorbet was very nice. Might return one day and try different dishes.
Waiter suggested a "day plate" it was overcooked and impossible eating. The waiter never came back so I couldn't ask for another plate and left the restaurant without eating.
Lovely , friendly, fresh. Going again...5 star
We've eaten here a couple of times. Last week was the last time. Not a good as it used to be. It felt like a place for the elderly. Old fashioned atmosphere. And the food used to be much better.
Used to be a great paella restaurant, but my last visit was disappointing. Starters were not good and paella was tasteless.

Food 8/10 Value 9/10 Owner/host/service 10/10.
It was almost like dining at someones home as a special guest. No menu was handed but we ate 7 course tasting menu chosen by our host. With a bottle of wine and moscatels it was 32€/person. You must visit this place!
Best place
Go with an open mind and an empty stomach. Well worth the visit.
Uno de los mejores restaurantes españoles/franceses en Alicante. Hay que probarlo por lo menos una vez. Todo muy bueno e excelente. 👍
Pequeño pero muy acogedor. Excelente cocina. Carta corta. Dejarse recomendar.
